description: FAA incidents with CONFIRMED drone malfunctions (crashes, flyaways, malfunctions) - highest credibility subset
data_quality_note: These cases contain explicit evidence of drone failure (operator stated, crashed, malfunctioned, etc.) unlike HIGH_RISK_SIGHTING which are just altitude/proximity sightings.
competition_note: Use this dataset for demos - these are real failures, not hypothetical scenarios.

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: VAN HORN, TX/UAS INCIDENT/2245C/ALBUQUERQUE ARTCC ADVISED RQ7B, OPERATOR STATED THE UAS MALFUNCTIONED AND ATTEMPTED TO RETURN TO VAN HORN. CHUTE DEPLOYED AND WENT DOWN 300 YARDS NE VHN. PROPERTY DAMAGE NOT REPORTED.
incidents.hazard_description: Motor/propeller/ESC failure causing thrust loss

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: DENVER, CO/UAS INCIDENT/1100M/CENTENNIAL ATCT ADVISED, MULTIPLE PILOTS REPORT A WHITE 1 FOOT BY 1 FOOT UAS CRASHED BETWEEN TWY B AND RUNWAY 35R. AIRPORT AUTHORITY RECOVERED UAS. NO IMPACT TO OPS. EVASIVE ACTION NOT REPORTED. NO REGISTRATION OR SERIAL NUMBER VISIBLE ON UAS. ARAPAHO COUNTY AIRPORT AUTHORITY NOTIFIED.
incidents.hazard_description: GPS signal loss or position hold failure

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: SYRACUSE, NY/UAS INCIDENT/0925E/ ANG MQ9 UAS CRASHED AT THE DEPARTURE END OF RWY 33 DUE TO ENGINE FAILURE. NO GROUND INJURIES OR DAMAGE REPORTED.  NO IMPACT TO AIRPORT OPS.  ROCHESTER FSDO NOTIFIED.
incidents.hazard_description: GPS signal loss or position hold failure

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: BOSTON, MA/UAS INCIDENT/1747E/MASSACHUSETTS STATE PD NOTIFIED BOSTON ATCT PERSONNEL OF A UAS OPERATING .5 WSW RUNWAY 4L. LEOS LOCATED THE UAS OPERATOR AND SECURED THE UAS. THE UAS OPERATOR STATED HE HAD AUTHORIZATION TO OPERATE THE UAS AND PRESENTED A CONFIRMATION CODE. NO ACFT INVOLVED AND NO IMPACT TO OPERATIONS.
incidents.hazard_description: GPS signal loss or position hold failure

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: MYRTLE BEACH, SC/UAS INCIDENT/LATE REPORT-1800E/MYRTLE BEACH ATCT ADVISED UNKN CALLSIGN, ROBINSON R44, REPORTED GREY UAS OPERATING 100 FEET ABOVE ADVENTURE HELICOPTER HELIPAD 3 N MYRTLE BEACH. UAS WAS IN FLIGHT PATH OF THE ROBINSON R44. NO EVASIVE ACTION REPORTED. AN ADVENTURE HELICOPTER EMPLOYEE CONFISCATED THE UAS . HORRY COUNTY SHERIFF NOTIFIED. GROUND UNITS RESPONDED AND IDENTIFIED OPERATOR. OPERATOR LOST CONTROL OF THE UAS WHILE FLYING IN AN ADJACENT FIELD. UAS RETURNED TO OPERATOR. NO CITATIONS ISSUED.
incidents.hazard_description: Control link loss or RC failsafe activation

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: DENVER, CO/UAS INCIDENT/1626M/CENTENNIAL ATCT REPORTED A UAS 1 SE APA AT 100-130 FEET ABOVE THE GROUND. NO ACFT IMPACTED. NO LEO NOTIFICATION REPORTED.
incidents.hazard_description: GPS signal loss or position hold failure

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: GRAND JUNCTION, CO/UAS INCIDENT/2130M/DENVER ARTCC ADVISED, MOAB FIRE OPERATIONS DISPATCH RECEIVED A REPORT OF A SMALL BLACK AND WHITE QUAD-COPTER UAS WITHIN THE PACK CREEK FIRE TFR . THE UAS WAS HOVERING OVER THE HELIPAD AT PACK CREEK FIRE OPERATIONS. AS A RESULT, FIREFIGHTING ACFT WERE ADVISED TO AVOID THE AREA AND OTHER ACFT WERE GROUNDED WITH BUCKET DROP OPERATIONS IMPACTED. THE GRAND COUNTY SHERIFF WAS NOTIFIED AND RESPONDED TO A RESIDENCE. AN INDIVIDUAL WAS IDENTIFIED AND INTERVIEWED. STATUS NOT REPORTED.
incidents.hazard_description: GPS signal loss or position hold failure

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: COLORADO SPRINGS, CO/UAS INCIDENT/1214M/COLORADO SPRINGS ATCT REPORTED A RUNAWAY UNPOWERED UAS ATTACHED TO TWO WEATHER BALLOONS FROM THE AIR FORCE ACADEMY. UAS LAST SEEN MOVING SW BOUND AT 15,000 FEET 7 WNW COLORADO SPRINGS. LEOS NOT NOTIFIED.
incidents.hazard_description: Battery failure or low voltage causing power loss

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: PENDLETON, OR/UAS INCIDENT/1155P/UAS, CRASHED AND CAUGHT FIRE UNDER UNKN CIRCUMSTANCES 1 WNW PDT. UAS WAS OPERATING AS PART 91 CERTIFICATE OF WAIVER AUTHORIZATION (COA) TEST FLIGHT ON A PRE-PLANNED ROUTE. NO IMPACT TO NAS REPORTED. NO INJURIES REPORTED. NO GROUND DAMAGES REPORTED. LEO WERE NOTIFIED VIA 911.
incidents.hazard_description: Control link loss or RC failsafe activation

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: MIAMI, FL/UAS INCIDENT/LATE REPORT - 1344E/UAS CRASHED INTO THE JW MARRIOT WHERE THE 49ERS ARE STAYING. NO INJURIES REPORTED. NO ACFT INVOLVED. MIAMI-DADE PD ARRESTED THE OPERATOR AND SEIZED THE UAS. LEO INTERVIEWED THE OPERATOR WHO WAS A UKRAINIAN CITIZEN, HAS A PART 107 CERTIFICATE, AND HAS THE UAS REGISTERED. OPERATORS INFORMATION NOT PROVIDED.
incidents.hazard_description: GPS signal loss or position hold failure

incidents.description: COLUMBUS, OH (CMH): REMOTE PILOT WAS CONDUCTING A TRAINING FLIGHT WHEN DURING LANDING HE WAS UNABLE TO MAINTAIN CONTROL OF DRONE. DRONE STRUCK AN AIRCRAFT INSIDE AN OPEN HANGER RESULTING IN SIGNIFICANT DAMAGE TO AIRCRAFT. NO INDIVIDUALS WERE INJURED DURING INCIDENT. 01/30/2020 1530Z
incidents.hazard_description: Control link loss or RC failsafe activation

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: STILLWATER, OK/UAS INCIDENT/1712C/OKLAHOMA HIGHWAY PATROL ADVISED A PART 107 OPERATOR OF A DJI PHANTOM 4 UAS LOST CONTROL OF UAS. THE UAS STRUCK THE WINDSHIELD OF A VEHICLE E BOUND ON HWY 51 19 E STILLWATER. NO INJURIES REPORTED. AMOUNT OF DAMAGE TO VEHICLE WAS UNDETERMINED. UAS PILOT'S NAME, LICENSE NUMBER, AND UAS REGISTRATION INFORMATION WAS PROVIDED TO THE WRS FSD. OKLAHOMA HIGHWAY PATROL CAN BE REACHED.
incidents.hazard_description: Control link loss or RC failsafe activation

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: CINCINNATI, OH/UAS INCIDENT/1030E/C-ROC ADVISED PART 107 UAS, CRASHED AFTER FILMING THE EXTERIOR OF A BUILDING, ENCOUNTERED DIFFICULTIES WHILE LANDING AT ABOUT 3 TO 4 FEET ABOVE GROUND, AND DRIFTED INTO A PARKED VEHICLE. UAS ACCIDENT CAUSED SCRATCH DAMAGE TO THE PARKED VEHICLE. NO GROUND INJURIES REPORTED. CINCINNATTI PD NOTIFIED.
incidents.hazard_description: GPS signal loss or position hold failure

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: ATLANTA, GA/UAS INCIDENT/1710E/ATLANTA ARTCC ADVISED CIRRUS SR22, SGJ - SRB, REPORTED A BLACK AND PINK UAS (OR MODEL ROCKET PARACHUTE) 500 FEET BELOW ACFT WHILE NW BOUND AT 14,000 FEET 50 NE ATLANTA. NO EVASIVE ACTION REPORTED. LEOS NOT NOTIFIED.
incidents.hazard_description: GPS signal loss or position hold failure

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: DENVER, CO/UAS INCIDENT/1014M/OPERATOR REPORTED UAS PART 107 ACCIDENT APPROXIMATELY 16 WSW DENVER. UAS WAS NOT RESPONDING TO OPERATOR CONTROLS AND CRASHED INTO A BUILDING BREAKING A WINDOW. NO INJURIES REPORTED.
incidents.hazard_description: Control link loss or RC failsafe activation

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: MINNEAPOLIS, MIN/UAS INCIDENT/LATE REPORT 3-20 2030C/UAS PILOT REPORTED A LOW-SPEED COLLISION WITH THE IDS TOWER. THE UAS CRASHED ON TOP THE CRYSTAL COURT GLASS ROOF AND POSSIBLY CRACKED A WINDOW. NO INJURIES REPORTED. WOC KC/MC
incidents.hazard_description: GPS signal loss or position hold failure

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: SAN JUAN, PUERTO RICO/UAS INCIDENT/2128L/USCG COMMAND CENTER REPORTED UAS WITH RED AND GREEN LIGHTS AT 100 FEET VCNTY US COAST GUARD BASE. UAS MANUEVERED INTO THE VICINITY OF SAN JUAN INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT (TJSJ) BEFORE RETURNING TO ORIGINAL LOCATION. NO IMPACT TO OPERATIONS OR ACFT IMPACTED.
incidents.hazard_description: Control link loss or RC failsafe activation

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: LAKELAND, FL/UAS INCIDENT/0930E/LAKELAND ATC ADVISED UAS CRASHED INTO VEHICLE AND BROKE WINDSHEILD. PROPERTY DAMAGE GREATER THAN 500 DOLLARS.
incidents.hazard_description: Motor/propeller/ESC failure causing thrust loss

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: LAKEWOOD, CO/UAS INCIDENT-ACCIDENT/LATE REPORT-1000M/LAKEWOOD PD ADVISED, SKYDIO X10 UAS, WHILE CONDUCTING A WELFARE CHECK AT A RESIDENCE WITH THEIR UAS, THE PARACHUTE DEPLOYED WITHOUT COMMAND AND CRASHED ONTO A BUILDING. NO DAMAGE TO BUILDING REPORTED. NO INJURIES REPORTED. THE UAS SUSTAINED MINOR DAMAGE. WOC PM/JR
incidents.hazard_description: Control link loss or RC failsafe activation

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: KERRVILLE, TX/UAS INCIDENT/LATE REPORT - 1755C/C-ROC ADVISED, H60, ERV - ERV, EXECUTED AN EMERGENCY LANDING AFTER THE TAIL ROTOR WAS STRUCK BY FA394F7K4N (TEXAS DPS), DJI MAVIC 3T, WHILE CONDUCTING JOINT SEARCH AND RESCUE OPERATIONS. FA394F7K4N WAS DESTROYED.  WAS INSPECTED AND RETURNED TO KERRVILLE ARPT WITHOUT FURTHER INCIDENT. INJURIES: NONE. DAMAGE: EXTENT UNKN. WOC KC/AJ
incidents.hazard_description: Motor/propeller/ESC failure causing thrust loss

incidents.description:
PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: GULFPORT, MS/UAS INCIDENT/1225C/GULFPORT ATCT ADVISED USN, T6, REPORTED A MODEL ROCKET WITH PARACHUTE AT 6,000 FEET VCNTY GULFPORT. NO EVASIVE ACTION REPORTED. GULFPORT PD NOTIFIED AND RESPONDED TO AREA

_x000D_
Summary:  REPORTED CLOSE PROXIMITY TO A MODEL ROCKET THAT APPEARED TO HAVE A PARACHUTE AT 6000'. NO EVASIVE ACTION WAS TAKEN GULFPORT POLICE WAS NOTIFIED AND DISPATCHED A UNIT TO INVESTIGATE. MARKED AS A FIXED WING DUE TO LACK OF OPTIONS.
incidents.hazard_description: GPS signal loss or position hold failure

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: DALLAS-FORT WORTH, TX/UAS INCIDENT/1500C/ A319, DFW - CVG, REPORTED DESCENDING UNMANNED PARACHUTE WHILE NE BOUND AT 14,000 FEET 20 ESE DFW. NO EVASIVE ACTION TAKEN. LEO NOTIFICATION NOT REPORTED
incidents.hazard_description: Motor/propeller/ESC failure causing thrust loss

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: TAMPA, FL/UAS INCIDENT/LATE REPORT-0900E/HILLSBOROUGH COUNTY SHERIFF REPORTED A DJI INSPIRE 1 UAS STRUCK A BAY SIDE POWER STATION TOWER BETWEEN 0900E AND 1100E. UAS DID NOT CONTAIN A MEMORY CARD, CARGO, OR FAA REGISTRATION NUMBER. POWER STATION REPORTS NO DAMAGE TO THE TOWER.
incidents.hazard_description: Battery failure or low voltage causing power loss

incidents.description: PRELIM INFO FROM FAA OPS: CHARLOTTE, NC/UAS INCIDENT/1900E/E-ROC ADVISED CHARLOTTE POLICE REPORTED A UAS CRASHED INTO THE SIDE OF THE BANK OF AMERICA STADIUM. NO EVENTS WERE SCHEDULED AT THE STADIUM AT THE TIME OF THE CRASH. NO GROUND INJURIES REPORTED. EXTENT OF DAMAGE TO THE STADIUM WAS NOT REPORTED.
incidents.hazard_description: GPS signal loss or position hold failure
